revised_title: William Whiteman Carlton Topley's Contributions to Epidemiology
tldr: The article is an obituary for William Whiteman Carlton Topley, a prominent bacteriologist and epidemiologist. Topley made significant contributions to the field of epidemiology, including his work on the study of changes in the pathogenicity of strains of B. Danysz and his research on epidemic curves. He emphasized the importance of understanding the factors that influence the spread of diseases, such as the pathogenicity of the specific parasite and the resistance of the host.
